attributes.action: abolish the Department for International Development (DFID) and use the money saved to fund charitable organisations in this country currently providing vital public services
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Although it is morally right that rich nations, such as Britain, should use their resources to promote development and reduce poverty overseas this is the remit of charity, not general taxation. The money saved from abolishing DFID should be used to fund vital public services in this country which currently rely to some extent on charitable donations - Lifeboats, McMillan Cancer Relief, RSPCA, Air Ambulances; to name a few. Space should me made on the tax return form to allow voluntary donations to oversees development organisations such as OXFAM.
